vocabulary.definition: having a subtle difference or distinction
vocabulary.example: She has a nuanced understanding of different cultures.
Water is essential for life to exist.

vocabulary.definition: one of two or more available possibilities
vocabulary.example: She offered an alternative solution to the problem.

vocabulary.definition: to give special importance or attention to something
vocabulary.example: He emphasized the need for teamwork in the project.

vocabulary.definition: to carry out a systematic or formal inquiry to discover and examine the facts of an issue
vocabulary.example: The police are investigating the crime scene for evidence.

vocabulary.definition: the feel or consistency of a surface or a substance
vocabulary.example: The cake had a smooth and creamy texture.

vocabulary.definition: the quality of being new, original, or unused
vocabulary.example: The freshness of the vegetables made the salad delicious.

vocabulary.definition: to cause someone to believe firmly in the truth of something
vocabulary.example: She managed to convince him to change his mind about the decision.
